I can't give the direct attribution yet, I think it might be from Huffington Post but I haven't been able to find the exact author:
 
 Eight Rules for Corporate America 
 
 1. Do no harm.
 
 2. Do not sell poison and call it food.
 
 3. Do not pay your workers such a low wage that they cannot buy both food and lodging.
 
 4. Do not allow your employees to live without elementary healthcare.
 
 5. Leave the natural world better than you found it.
 
 6. Don't cheat on your taxes, your accounting, or your business practices.
 
 7. Don't steal elections.
 
 8. Administer all aspects of your business with the understanding that all citizens have basic human worth.
It's a pity. Corporations have more power these days than government. They will draft their own list that safeguards shareholders.

Corporations have more power these days than government.

 
 Say it with me.....fascism! emoticon_mad
